website_summaries.verdict: The Canon EOS M50 is the company's first affordable camera with 4K, but there are better mirrorless options out there for video.
cons: 4K video is cropped with slower autofocus
Limited shots when shooting Raw bursts

customer_reviews.title: Just IMPRESSED
customer_reviews.text: When I decided to buy this camera, I was just sceptic, so I had first to make sure reading reviews and watching videos about the product... It came very fast, after a couple of days, and it was for me, breath taking! This is a semi professional camera which allows you to take very good pictures and the beautiful thing (well it's all beautiful) it's that it's not heavy! It's very comfy in your hands, and with the adaptor for the lenses, you can use all the lenses that you like. I will update the video part, I have to buy a good gimball soon... I'm very happy with it, totally suggested!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for youtube videos and for photos
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make cooking videos for my youtube channel. It is easy to use and the results are great - but you will require an external mic for decent audio, as the internal mic sound quality is very poor when recording video. I have only used it's basic / automatic settings, so can't comment on how good a lot of the features are, but for what I bought it for (food photography, recipe videos and vlogging) it is excellent, and very forgiving for a beginner. I recommend buying an external mike which will plug in and attach on top of the camera, and a tripod.

The canon m6 11 whila good camera in my opinion is not as convenient as the m 50. as for batery life i shot 10gb of still photographs on friday and still had power in the battery, used my 100-400 zoom a lot of the time and the af was fine. The picture quality is great, but you will need good lenses to pair with the camera. My recommendation is to buy an adaptor that allows EF and EF-S lenses to be plugged in. The only issues I think is the dynamic range, that it's not anywhere near my Canon 77D, and the lack of IS

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera for both photography and video!
customer_reviews.text: The Canon M50 is a great camera for anyone wanting to learn photography or shoot videos for YouTube etc. It can be used in auto mode for absolute beginners, but it comes into its own when you switch it to manual. There is loads of helpful tuition videos on YouTube that learn you how to make the best of it for various projects. ThinkMedia YouTube Channel would be the first place I'd go to to get started as they have loads of M50 content. In conclusion I really love this camera and it was worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: MillieGuitar

customer_reviews.title: Great small body for hosting EF lenses (with EF-M adapter) at a good price point.
customer_reviews.text: The Canon webcam app converts this to a (Skype/Zoom/Teams etc) web cam - which with decent lens gives great depth of field. The downside is you have to remember to open the screen when using in web cam mode. Remember the combination of smaller sensor and lens adaptor for EF lenses means you get more zoomed in images than you expect. Set everything to manual to avoid automatic adjustments. Cheap battery replacement power adaptors are available. Combining with free OBS software (and reasonable microphone) results in a good desktop recording setup.
customer_reviews.author: Binocularity

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera. M50 Canon. Great seller!
customer_reviews.text: Loving this camera. Easy to use. I had a Nixonn D5000 and was apprehensive to change brands as I have a lot of lens. But it was the best thing, this M50 is streets ahead of the D5000, especially as a social media camera. The flip screen is great and Nixon higher end models don’t even have this. The only other camera I thought of was a Sony, but even it did not have the great reviews on the touch screen as this.

Highly recommend to entry level or mid level photographers or vloggers.
